feed.title: SAP Community - SD (Sales and Distribution)
feed.subtitle: SD (Sales and Distribution) Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: Customer expected price condition type EDI1
entry.content:
Hi All, I am working on the customer expected price condition type EDI1. I have created a sales order and it has normal price with PPR0 condition type. I have entered the customer expected price condition type EDI1 manually and entered some price less than the price of PPR0. system showed incomplete document due to price difference, when I save the sales order.  After this I went to Fiori app Manage Sales documents with Customer expected price and in the sales order I have clicked on Accept customer price button as shown in the below screen shot and observed that system is not replacing the actual price with expected customer price. am I missing some settings or is this standard behavior. Do we need to change the price manually.? Please guide.  

Thanks

Kumar

entry.title: Display-Only Authorization for Manage Tax Rates & Sales Prices in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
entry.content:
I would like to ask for your advice about authorization settings in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (SAP Grow).

For the Manage Tax Rates and Manage Sales Prices apps, is there a way to configure authorizations so that users can view the data only (Display Only) but cannot edit or create new records?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: Customer Classification setup to be captured in a TR
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I'm setting up the Customer Classification with CL02 and CT04. But these TCODEs are not asking for TR while saving.
Now how can i capture this setup in TR

Kindly help.

Thanks

entry.title: Create Billing for Service ID
entry.content:
Question :
During the billing process, the Service ID maintained in the service order does not appear as a billing item. Instead, the system displays the material assigned in the DIP Profile, rather than the actual Service ID from the service order.
What is the correct SAP standard configuration that allows the Service ID recorded in the service order to appear as the billing item, instead of the material derived from the DIP Profile?

Current (As-Is) Condition :
When creating a billing document for a Service Order, the item that appears in the billing document is “Material as Service”, rather than the Service ID maintained in the service order.

I have already tried entering the activity number / service ID in the “Source” field under the Set Name column, so that it would appear as the activity number / service ID during billing and quotation. However, this approach still does not work.

I forgot to mentioned that this issue also happened in quotation. process as well.

Best regards,
Ester Wang

entry.title: Sales order creation from cxml document
entry.content:
Hello,

We have one customer who is using a P2P solution which is able to send his purchase order as PO Cxml message. The objective is to create a sales document (sales order or sales quotation #S4/HANA SD#) using this cxml document.

I know we can deliver using ABAP code but I didn't find any standard way to proceed. I have even looked into SAP Business Network but resources related to sell side is not clear. 

Have I missed something ?

entry.title: How to store VA05 sales order list data into a custom Z table
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I have a requirement to store the sales order list data (similar to VA05 output) into a custom Z table for reporting and reconciliation purposes.

The VA05 transaction shows a combined view of:
Sales order header data (VBAK)
Item data (VBAP)
Schedule lines (VBEP)
Business data (VBKD)
Status information (VBUK/VBUP)

My questions are:
Is it recommended to capture VA05 output directly, or should the data be read from the underlying tables (VBAK, VBAP, VBEP, VBKD, etc.)?
Is there any BAPI or standard function module that returns the complete VA05 dataset suitable for mass extraction?
What is the best-practice approach to design a Z table structure to store VA05-like data?
Header + Item in one table?
Separate header and item Z tables?
How do SAP standard programs usually handle such requirements (e.g., snapshot reporting, audit, historical reporting)?

I understand that VA05 is a reporting transaction and may use internal logic rather than a single SELECT statement.
I want to follow SAP-recommended design, especially with respect to performance and data consistency.

Any guidance or references would be highly appreciated.

Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Terms of Payment difference in T-code BP and Table report
entry.content:
When I enter BP of a customer found its payment terms data are different with the report I export (Customer master data report KNB1),

May i know the reason ? The data maintained in BP is the correct

entry.title: Customer Master without company code info
entry.content:
Hello SAP Guru's,

I recently found a customer master where the company code section is missing all entries, except the actual company code. The business is now trying to post manual credits, which they are not able to do because of the missing reconciliation account.

I tried to extend the account with XD01 and FD01 but it keeps telling me that the account already exists.

Are there any other ways to make the necessary entries?

Thank you in advance.

Silke

entry.title: MRP with material substitution
entry.content: This is an intercompany sales scenario in which orders are placed from field locations to manufacturing plants.  The requirement is to have a way to deplete stock of the current part number but at the same time gradually allow for X amount of the new part number to be sold. They make both materials the current and the new. They want to fulfill 90% of demand with the current part number and 10% with the New part number in the first month. Then in the 2nd month they want to fulfill 80% of demand with current part number and 20% with New part number etc.

entry.title: MRP material substitution
entry.content: This is an intercompany sales scenario in which orders are placed from field locations to manufacturing plants.. The business requirement is to have a way to deplete stock of the current part number but at the same time gradually allow for X amount of the new part number to be sold. They make both materials the current and the new. They want to fulfill 90% of demand with the current PN and 10% with the New PN in the first month. Then in the 2nd month they want to fulfill 80% of demand with current PN and 20% with New PN. etc. via MRP.

entry.title: SAP ECC static credit limit not met, new order exceeds limit without block
entry.content: Scenario: Customer has credit risk set to static with a block for open orders and open deliveries. Credit risk has not been exceeded. Credit Limit is $50,000 USD.  New order is for $75,000.  New order takes the customer over the credit limit but the order does not block.  Is there a way to check the order during create, prior to saving, to see if it will cause the customer to exceed the limit?

entry.title: How to configure TCS on sales with a 27C certificate for a customer?
entry.content:
Hello SAP Experts,

I am looking for a solution like an indicator (Maintained ID) is triggered automatically once the PAN number is maintained in the Business Partner (BP).

The scenario for which solution is am looking for is involves configuring TCS on sales with a 27C certificate for a customer. Currently, this is achieved by adding the Sold-To party in the TCS access sequence.

Is there any standard solution or functionality where we can upload the certificate with a valid date range, so that the system sets the indicator for that range and resets it when the certificate is range expire?

This approach would eliminate the dependency on maintaining the Sold-To in the access sequence and allow a single record with a control codes to work effectively.

Your insights, experiences, or references to SAP Notes/Guidelines would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Billing plan details capturing issue against the contract item in SAP ECC
entry.content:
Hello All,

We have been facing an issue while processing the milestone billing against the contract item even we follow sequential process.

Config: 

1. we have enabled the billing plan at item category level and did the remain functional setup

Development the program with the below standard BAPIs/FMs

1. BAPI_CONTRACT_CREATEFROMDATA

2. BILLING_SCHEDULE_GENERATE

3.BILLING_SCHEDULE_GET_NUMBER

4.BILLING_SCHEDULE_SAVE  - Here we are trying to insert the billing plan details 

5.SD_SALES_DOCUMENT_SAVE

6.BAPI_TRANSACTION_COMMIT

Outcome: The billing plan details aren't storing in the DB and can't be seen in VBKD,FPLA & FPLT etc.,

Note: We would appreciate any suggestions or inputs from your end.

and when i check log it is showing me like this

entry.title: Block Pricing Condition Input in VA02
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have a requirement to block condition input in tax jurisdiction conditions when changing a sales order.

As far as I know, I need to maintain this configuration as “Manual entry has priority” for jurisdiction conditions.

 

Tax rates are coming from FTXP (FI), but users should not be able to change these rates.

I found some includes, but I am not sure how to use them. If you know anything about this, please let me know : 

LV69AFZZ
LV69AF01 - FORM tctrl_konditionen_init .


Kind regards,

Nedim Yilmaz

entry.title: customer order exceeds credit limit and doesn't block, customer has negative receivables
entry.content: Scenario: Customer has credit risk set to static with a block for open orders and open deliveries. Credit limit has not been exceeded. Credit Limit is $175,000 USD.  New order is for $2,075,000.  New order takes the customer over the credit limit but the order does not block.  The customer had negative receivables.  Does the negative receivables impact the credit check?

entry.title: Problems with the pricing condition on the SD invoice
entry.content:
Hello

I'm having this problem with the ZPCI internal price condition in PRD. When I review the invoice analysis, the declaration it's showing me is 216, "Value of the condition transferred from previous document."

In the QA environment it shows me the correct value which should be 213 Amount adopted from the material valuation segment.

I checked the V/08, V/06, and VTFL transactions, and all the settings are the same in both PRD and QA. It should be mentioned that when making the delivery, the order created in VA01 shows the correct QA price.

VTFL

V/06

V/08

Does anyone know where else I can check to get the PRD to show me declaration 216?

 

SD Sales SD (Sales and Distribution)

entry.title: Sales Order Plant Field Greyed Out for Header BOM
entry.content:
Hello Everyone,

I need help with the following scenario. I have configured the BOM setup, and when I enter the material in the sales order, the BOM explodes and the plant is automatically determined.

However, the requirement is to change the plant in the sales order after saving the document. Currently, the plant field is greyed out for the header BOM and cannot be edited.

Could you please advise how this can be handled?

entry.title: Requirement for Customer-Specific Transit Time in SAP
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We have a requirement to define different transit times for customers. Currently, all country-level customers have a standard transit time of 35 days. However, there is one specific customer who requires a transit time of 56 days.

Is there a standard solution in SAP to handle this kind of customer-specific transit time requirement?

Thank you.

entry.title: How to use the $SUM_PARTS function to get the weights of the components used in a configuration?
entry.content:
Good afternoon,

I have a configurable finished material, which has configurable materials as components and standard components assigned in the BOM. I want to calculate the total weight based on the components used. The components selected in the BOM depend on the configuration of FG01. As mentioned, some components are also configurable and the configuration and the weight is based on the configuration of FG01.

Thus something like this:

LevelMaterialRemarks
0FG01Finished material
1Configurable comp. 1Always included in BOM, weight depends on configuration of FG01
1.1Component 1.1 
1.2Components 1.2 
1Configurable comp. 2Selection depends on configuration, weight depends on configuration of FG01
1.1Component 2.1 
1.2Components 2.2 
1Standard component 1Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 2Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 3Always included in BOM, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 4Selection depends on configuration, standard weight from material master
1Standard component 5Selection depends on configuration, standard weight from material master

As I understand, I can use the $SUM_PARTS function in my dependency, with a syntax similar to this:

$SELF.WEIGHT = $SUM_PARTS ($PARENT, WEIGHT).

If I understand the documentation, I have to assign characteristics WEIGHT to all configurable components. 

"To add together the weights of the different components in a BOM, create characteristic WEIGHT and allocate it to all the configurable materials that you want to include in your calculation."

  • Should WEIGHT be a reference characteristic? If yes, to which table and field?
  • How to I retrieve the weight from the standard components that are not configurable and thus have no class assignment?

Moreover, I don't really understand this part.

"Create a configurable material as a placeholder and enter this material as the last item in the BOM. Assign characteristic WEIGHT is to the material. Allocate a procedure with the following source code to the BOM item: $SELF.WEIGHT = $SUM_PARTS ($PARENT, WEIGHT)"

  • How can I assure that this placeholder is not included in the production BOM?

Summarized, I have the following three questions:

  • Should WEIGHT be a reference characteristic? If yes, to which table and field?
  • How to I retrieve the weight from the standard components that are not configurable and thus have no class assignment?
  • How can I assure that the placeholder in the BOM is not included in the production BOM?

Kind regards,

 

Floyd
